requirement.name: Approved lower division elective for Labor Studies major

templateAssets.content:
The Labor Studies major offers UCLA undergraduates an opportunity to learn about the workplace and the social, political, and economic forces that influence it. The program places emphasis on the labor market, public policy, employment relations, unions, and working-class movements. It also explores issues of race, class, and gender in the workplace. By critically analyzing the theory and practice of current workplace issues, students develop a deeper understanding of the relationships between their education and society at large and how they, as college graduates, can transform the nature of work.


Listed below are the lower division preparation courses for the major.


To be considered for this major, you must complete the following courses by the end of the spring before transfer:

  • One interdisciplinary Labor History course
  • One Social Structure and Contemporary Conditions course related to labor and/or social movements
  • Two courses from:
  • Introduction to Black Studies 
  • Asian American movement
  • Introduction to Gender Studies
  • Globalization: regional development and world economy
  • History of Asian Americans
  • Introduction to Chicano/a studies
  • Modern Latin America 

Note: If there are no existing, articulated courses, applicants should demonstrate sincere interest in the major and are encouraged to complete IGETC or the general education course pattern.

All courses must be completed with a letter grade.

In addition, applicant must complete 60 semester units/ 90 transferable quarter units units with a 3.2 GPA by the end of spring before transfer.


For more information regarding this major and UCLA's transfer selection process, visit https://irle.ucla.edu/labor-studies and https://admission.ucla.edu.


PLEASE NOTE: the community college courses listed below have been approved to satisfy the preparation for this major at UCLA, but they may not be exact equivalents of the UCLA courses.

course.courseTitle: Work, Labor, and Social Justice in U.S.
Work, Labor, and Social Justice in U.S.
Work, Labor, and Social Justice in U.S.
Work, Labor, and Social Justice in U.S.
Work, Labor, and Social Justice in U.S.: Special Topics

templateAssets.content: No AP or IB exams are considered equivalent, and credit earned from those exams cannot be used towards the Labor Studies major prep.
